page.title: 03The Old Airfield 2
page.content: Forty years after the end of the Second World War, very little of the airfield remains and the land is farmed again. One runway has been removed and planted with poplar trees and the other runways are much narrower. The perimeter track is still intact. Three hangers have had their sides strengthened and have become grain stores. They each hold 10,000 tons of grain for the European Economic Community. The hangers are filled using a mobile grain elevator. There is also a weigh-bridge for lorries which transport grain. Grain is stored here from within a radius of 75 miles. There is a site for gypsies on the airfield. In April of this year the C.N.D protesters from Molesworth tried to settle here in "Rainbow Village" but they were moved on.
